npcs.name: Sarah Mitchell
npcs.problem: Lost everything in a fire. Can't afford apartment.

dialogue.text: I... I don't know where else to go. Everything I owned is in a plastic bag right now.
dialogue.hint: She clutches a red plastic bag tightly.

dialogue.text: Three things survived. This ring, this collar, this ticket. They don't mean anything to me anymore. But I can't throw them away either. Does that make sense?

choices.response: The ring was my grandmother's. She gave it to me before... before everything. I was supposed to give it to him. But he didn't show up.
I was late coming home from work. Five minutes. If I'd been there five minutes earlier...
I just need... I don't know. Someone to tell me these things mean something. Or nothing. Either way.

dialogue.text: Thank you. For listening. I think... I think I needed to tell someone.

npcs.name: David Chen
npcs.problem: Looking for his father's watch. 30 years of searching.

dialogue.text: I come here every year. On the anniversary. It's been 30 years now.
dialogue.hint: He leans on a cane, looking tired.

dialogue.text: My father died near here. The watch... it stopped when he fell. I've been looking for it ever since. Stupid, isn't it? A watch won't bring him back.

choices.response: He was a good man. A doctor. He was rushing to save someone when it happened. A heart attack. Someone he couldn't reach in time.

choices.playerChoice: The watch - what happened to it?
choices.response: Lost in the chaos. The paramedics took everything. But I keep dreaming about it. The hands stopped at 11:47.

npcs.name: Margaret Cole
npcs.problem: Recognizes herself in a photograph taken before the shop existed.

dialogue.text: This might sound strange, but... have you seen this photograph before?
dialogue.hint: She holds an old sepia photograph with trembling hands.

dialogue.text: That's me. But I've never been here. This shop wasn't built until 1995. And I'm... I'm much older than this now.

choices.playerChoice: That's you? When was it taken?
choices.response: I don't know. I found it in my mother's things after she passed. 1975, maybe? But I don't remember ever visiting this street.

choices.playerChoice: Do you remember a red bicycle?
choices.response: A red bicycle... yes. No. Maybe? The memories are so confusing now.

npcs.name: Marcus Webb
npcs.problem: Famous jazz musician looking for the saxophone that made him famous.

dialogue.text: They say you find strange things here. I'm looking for something that shouldn't exist anymore.
dialogue.hint: He wears expensive clothes but looks haunted.

dialogue.text: I became famous because of this saxophone. But I don't remember getting it. One night I had nothing. The next, I had this. And everyone knew my name.

choices.response: A club. Smoke. Someone handing me a case. And then... nothing. I woke up famous.
I don't know. The memories are like trying to hold water. There's someone else's face there. Someone who wanted to play but never did.

npcs.name: Dr. Lisa Park
npcs.problem: Rushing to save someone. Won't make it in time. Needs something.

dialogue.text: I have eleven minutes. Eleven minutes to save a man's life. And I'm standing here talking to you.
dialogue.hint: She looks desperate, checking her watch repeatedly.

dialogue.text: Cardiac arrest. He's 45 minutes away. If I had any information... a file, anything that could tell me what caused this...

choices.response: His family said there's a file at the hospital. But the system crashed. I can't access it.
Thank you. I... I don't know why I came here. Old habits, I suppose.

npcs.name: Emily Torres
npcs.problem: Wants to warn her mother about something. But she's from a different timeline.

dialogue.text: This is going to sound insane, but... I'm not supposed to be here. Not really.
dialogue.hint: She looks around nervously, like she's not sure where she is.

dialogue.text: There's something I need to tell my mother. About a drive. A wrong turn. A red light. But I'm from... I'm from somewhere that didn't happen.

choices.response: She's still alive. In another life. I watched her die. This time I'm going to save her.

choices.playerChoice: I can help. Tell me more.
choices.response: There's a letter. I was supposed to write it. But I was so angry. And then it was too late.

npcs.name: Lily
npcs.problem: The final NPC. Appears only after all memories are unlocked.

dialogue.hint: A young girl stands in the doorway. She looks exactly like the photographs.

dialogue.text: You were there that night. I was so scared. And then... you made a choice.

choices.response: I was real. I am real. But you changed things. And now I don't know if I'm supposed to be here.
You didn't choose wrong. You chose. And that's what matters.

dialogue.text: The shop needs someone to remember. Will you stay?
